intro: Hieracium eudaedalium, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow flowers with ray florets that resemble petals, and it has a rosette of basal leaves. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Hieracium eudaedalium is also known for its ability to spread rapidly through rhizomes, making it an invasive species in some regions.
